subject: Re: [junit] Question about JUnit 4 execution
msgSnippet: Hi, ... I m not sure what you mean by unique to this class but the static field initialized by a @BeforeClass method is accessible by all instances of the
messageBody:
Hi,

On Jan 28, 2008 4:37 PM, milanmilanovich <milanmilanovich@...> wrote:
> public class Test {
> public static MyClass ins;
> @BeforeClass
> public static void beforeAllMethod() {
> ins = new MyClass();
> // Is this "ins" object available in all @Test methods in the class?
> }
> }
>
> My question is related to the static "ins" object, is this object
> unique to this Class and its @Test methods during JUnit test of this
> test class ?

I'm not sure what you mean by "unique to this class" but the static
field initialized by a @BeforeClass method is accessible by all
instances of the test class and therefore by all @Test methods.


Lasse

--
Lasse Koskela
* Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
* Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
